text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

section.section:
"Administrative function" means the administration of:
a law of the State;
a law of a political subdivision of the State; or
a rule, regulation, or bylaw of a public body.

text.section: "Board" means the State Open Meetings Law Compliance Board.

section.section: "Judicial function" means the exercise of any power of the Judicial Branch of the State government.
"Judicial function" does not include the exercise of rulemaking power by a court.

text.section: "Meet" means to convene a quorum of a public body for the consideration or transaction of public business.

"Public body" includes:
any multimember board, commission, or committee appointed by the Governor or the chief executive authority of a political subdivision of the State, or appointed by an official who is subject to the policy direction of the Governor or chief executive authority of the political subdivision, if the entity includes in its membership at least 2 individuals not employed by the State or the political subdivision;
any multimember board, commission, or committee that:
The Maryland School for the Blind.

text.section:
"Quasi-judicial function" means a determination of:
a contested case to which Subtitle 2 of this title applies;
a proceeding before an administrative agency for which Title 7, Chapter 200 of the Maryland Rules would govern judicial review; or
a complaint by the Board in accordance with this subtitle.

"Quasi-legislative function" means the process or act of:
adopting, disapproving, amending, or repealing a rule, regulation, or bylaw that has the force of law, including a rule of a court;
approving, disapproving, or amending a budget; or
approving, disapproving, or amending a contract.

"Quorum" means:
a majority of the members of a public body; or
any different number that law requires.
